vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/3eb60a50-4a1d-4059-8208-6f3b09075100">VIET NAM</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) Industrial Demand-Supply Balance Database</i> (IDSB) database contains data for over 90 countries based on the 4-digit level of ISIC Revision 3. Annual time series data (in current US dollars) from 1990 onwards are provided for eight items:<ul><li>domestic output</li><li>total imports</li><li>total exports</li><li>apparent consumption</li><li>imports from developing and emerging industrial economies</li><li>imports from industrialized economies</li><li>exports to developing and emerging industrial economies</li><li>exports to industrialized economies</li></ul>The data pertain to manufacturing and are arranged according to Revision 3 of ISIC at the 4 digit level, which comprises 127 industries. They are presented by country, industry and year. Coverage in terms of years, as well as data items, may vary from country to country depending on data availability.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br><ul><li>aerospace industry</li><li>agricultural industries</li><li>agroindustry</li><li>chemical industry</li><li>construction industry</li><li>consumption</li><li>consumption (economics)</li><li>dairy industry</li><li>dairy products industry</li><li>econometrics</li><li>economic analysis</li><li>economic forecasting</li><li>electronic industries</li><li>electronics industry</li><li>employment</li><li>employment (economic theory)</li><li>energy industries</li><li>food industry</li><li>food industry and trade</li><li>full employment</li><li>industrial development</li><li>industrial economics</li><li>industrial efficiency</li><li>industrial location</li><li>industrial organization (economic theory)</li><li>industrial production</li><li>industrial productivity</li><li>industrial statistics</li><li>industries</li><li>industry</li><li>labor productivity</li><li>macroeconomics</li><li>manufacturing industries</li><li>manufacturing industry</li><li>metal industry</li><li>metal trade</li><li>national accounting</li><li>national income/accounting</li><li>part time employment</li><li>power industry</li><li>shipbuilding industry</li><li>supply and demand</li><li>textile industry</li><li>unemployment</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The  <i>UNIDO Demand-Supply Balance Database</i> contains annual time series data. Coverage varies from country to country.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>The <i>UNIDO Industrial Demand-Supply Balance Database</i> covers a number of countries listed on the <a class="external" href="http://www.unido.org/Data1/Statistics/Databases/IDSBAV.cfm" title="UNIDO IDSB Data Availability">UNIDO IDSB Data Availability</a> webpage.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>annual. These data are updated annually.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See the <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/industrial-statistics.aspx>dataset user guide</a> for details.</sampProc>         <collMode>Transcription of existing materials</collMode>         <collMode><br>Four major sources have been used in compiling and cleaning the data contained in the UNIDO database:<br> i) industry data reported in country questionnaires<br>ii) national publications for industrial censuses, annual surveys and input-output tables<br>iii) international sources, both published and unpublished<br>iv) national data compiled by statisticians engaged by UNIDO to work in specific countries<br>Furthermore, the data have been supplemented with UNIDO estimates. <br>Data for OECD member countries are collected by OECD through OECD/UNIDO joint country questionnaires and provided to UNIDO for inclusion in the database.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.  See documentation for details.</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Restricted access</specPerm>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>Title and ownership of the Industrial Statistics databases remain with UNIDO.<br>  UNIDO grants you the right to use the databases and associated materials for the purposes of education, teaching, distance learning, private study or research only. Unauthorised publication, distribution or commercial use is prohibited. Box 300<br> A-1400 Vienna, Austria<br> stat@unido.org</conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>4753 UNIDO Industrial Statistics Databases,  1963-2010 </relStdy>       <relStdy>6286 UN Comtrade database, 1962-2013 </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
